builder-onboarding.title: Welcome to the Builder,
builder-onboarding.description: Let us show you all the new and exciting things that you can do with CARTO.

toolbar.title: Toolbar
toolbar.description: The toolbar provides options to access to your dashboard, edit your map, and configure its settings.

configurator.title: Editor pane
configurator.description: Manage all the components of your map: add layers and widgets, import datasets, customize analyses, and change styles.

widgets.title: Widgets pane
widgets.description: The widgets you add to your map appear directly on your visualization.

analyses-onboarding.geometries-updated: The geometries in your table were updated
analyses-onboarding.new-column-added: A new column has been added to your dataset.
analyses-onboarding.new-columns-created: New columns have been created as a new dataset.
analyses-onboarding.new-column-included: A new column has been included with your original data.
analyses-onboarding.new-columns-included: New columns has been included with your original data.
analyses-onboarding.new-columns-included-based-on-input: New columns have been included with your original data based on the columns chosen for the input.

sampling.title: Subsample of rows
sampling.description: A sample of your original table was randomly selected to give approximately %{percentage}% of the rows from your input dataset.

merge.title: Join columns from 2nd layer
merge.description: This analysis performed a columnar JOIN in order to get columns from two different tables.

intersection.title: Filter points in polygons
intersection.description: This analysis performs a spatial intersection, returning only the rows from the target layer which intersect with geometries in the source layer.
intersection.source-cartodb-id: This number represents the cartodb_id of the source geometry

area-of-influence.title: Create areas of influence
area-of-influence.description: Area of influence creates polygons according to the parameters set by the user.
area-of-influence.the-geom: This column was updated to show the area of influence requested.

aggregate-intersection.title: Intersect second layer
aggregate-intersection.description: This operation performs a spatial intersection and aggregates the geometry values from the target layer that intersect with the geometry of the source layer.
aggregate-intersection.count-vals-density: This column is added if COUNT was chosen as the aggregation operation
aggregate-intersection.extra-column: This column is added if {operation_type} is chosen with column {column_name}

filter.title: Row filtering
filter.description: Row filtering allows you to quickly narrow down the total data you display on a map or input into an analysis node.

filter-by-node-column.title: Filter by layer
filter-by-node-column.description: Filter by layer allows you to filter the data in your layer by propagating the filters in the '%{name_of_the_layer}' layer. Now if you filter on widgets added to the attached layer, the results in this layer would be also filtered.

spatial-markov-trend.trend: The normalized trend for each geometry
spatial-markov-trend.trend_up: The probability that a geometry's value will move to a higher class
spatial-markov-trend.trend_down: The probability that a geometry's value will move to a lower class
spatial-markov-trend.volatility: A measure of the potential for a geometry to possess values in other classes
spatial-markov-trend.description: Trends and volatility are calculated based on the time series data input. Trends calculated from inputs with a longer history are more precise. Inputs for the time column should equally spaced (e.g., all one week/month/year apart).

moran.title: Detect outliers and clusters
moran.description: Detect outliers and clusters finds areas in your data where clusters of high values or low values exist, as well as areas which are dissimilar from their neighbors.
moran.quads: Classification of the geometry from the analysis
moran.significance: The statistical significance of the geometry's classification of one of four quadrant types.
moran.moran: The local statistic calculated from the Moran's I analysis for each geometry/value in the dataset.
moran.rowid: The original row id of the geometry (cartodb_id).

kmeans.title: Calculating point clusters
kmeans.cluster-no: A numeric identifier for each cluster in your dataset. Values start at 1 and go up to the %{clusters} clusters you requested (or max rows if less).
kmeans.description: Point clustering is uses k-means to calculate a predefined number of clusters from your data.

data-observatory-measure.title: Enrich from the Data Observatory
data-observatory-measure.custom-column: This column contains the data requested from the Data Observatory
data-observatory-measure.description: The Data Observatory enrichment is the result of the geometry location and the measure requested.

georeference.title: Georeference
georeference.the-geom: This column, which stores the geographic information in your dataset, has been updated to reflect the boundaries or locations from the inputs specified.
georeference.description: Georeferencing data is a service that uses information from many sources to get the geographical information associated with latitude/longitude columns, city names, postal codes, administrative boundaries, IP addresses, or street addresses.

centroid.title: Calculating centroids from geometries
centroid.description: Centroids are calculated from all, groups, or singular geometries. Using the optional parameters of Category, Aggregate, and Weight you can change how they are calculated and what information the result will contain.
centroid.the-geom: Point geometries representing the centroid(s) of your input data.
centroid.aggregated-value: Stores the aggregate value for each centroid.
centroid.non-aggregated-value: Contains the count of features considered for each centroid
centroid.category: Stores the category value for each centroid from the source dataset

import-model.error-starting-import: Unfortunately, there was an error starting the import

upload-model.one-file: Unfortunately, only one file is allowed per upload
upload-model.file-extension: Unfortunately, this file extension is not allowed
upload-model.file-size: Unfortunately, the size of the file is bigger than your remaining quota
upload-model.visualization-id: The remote visualization id was not specified
upload-model.remote-file-size: Unfortunately, the size of the remote dataset is bigger than your remaining quota
upload-model.url-invalid: Unfortunately, the URL provided is not valid
upload-model.connection-error: Unfortunately, there was a connection error

geocoding-error-details.description: There was a problem georeferencing your data
geocoding-error-details.title: Geocoding Error
geocoding-error-details.try-again: Please try again and if the problem persists, contact us with the following code:

geocoding-success-detail.amount-charged: $%{price} will be charged to your account
geocoding-success-detail.credits-consumed: You have consumed all your credits during this billing cycle, price is $%{price} / 1,000 extra credits.
geocoding-success-detail.description: We've successfully geocoded <%- realRowsFormatted %> <%- geometryType %> of <%- processableRowsFormatted %>. |||| We've successfully geocoded <%- realRowsFormatted %> <%- geometryType %>s of <%- processableRowsFormatted %>.
geocoding-success-detail.explanation: Rows that are not geocoded could have errors in their column values, or don’t exist in our data. Try geocoding again and check the 'override all values' to try again.
geocoding-success-detail.no-extra-charge: No extra charges have been done
geocoding-success-detail.remainingQuotaFormatted: You still have %{remainingQuotaFormatted} credits left for this month.
geocoding-success-detail.title: Data geocoded
geocoding-success-detail.try-again: Unsuccessful rows don't count against your quota, so we encourage you to take a look and try again.

geocoding-no-result-details.description: These rows contained empty values or perhaps we just didn't know what the values meant. We encourage you to take a look and try again.
geocoding-no-result-details.title: No rows were georeferenced

warnings-details.find-connected-datasets: You can find all the connected datasets under the datasets section.
warnings-details.no-more-datasets: No more than %{maxTablesPerImport} datasets can be imported from a single file.
warnings-details.unable-to-import-datasets: Unable to import all datasets in file

partial-import-details.find-connected-datasets: You can find all the connected datasets under the datasets section.
partial-import-details.too-many-datasets: NOTE: The file you uploaded contained too many datasets. No more than %{maxTablesPerImport} datasets can be imported from a single file.
partial-import-details.unable-to-import-as-layers: Unable to add all imported datasets as layers
partial-import-details.upgrade-your-account: Upgrade your account to add more than %{userMaxLayers} layers to your maps.

error-details.check-url: Check that the URL you provided is OK
error-details.dont-panic: Don’t panic, here's some info that might help
error-details.remote-server-code: The remote server returned a %{httpResponseCode} code.
error-details.send-us-the-error-code: Persisting error? Please send us the following code

share.unpublished-subheader: From the moment you click on publish, you will need to use this window to update your changes on the public version.

embed.body: Insert your map into your blog, website, or simple application.

cartodbjs.body: Add your map to your applications using this URL.

error.title: We couldn't save your data
error.subtitle: We had an internal error trying to save your data. We recommend you try again.

organization.title: Default settings for your Organization
organization.desc: New users will have this permission

add-analysis.modal-desc: Select the analysis you want to add
add-analysis.disabled-option-desc: Your layer's geometries are %{simpleGeometryType} and this analysis needs %{requiredInputGeometries}

aggregate-intersection.title: Intersect second layer
aggregate-intersection.desc: Intersect with a second layer and calculate aggregations on the fly.

area-of-influence.title: Create areas of influence
area-of-influence.desc: Use travel time (e.g. walking or driving) or distance to calculate areas of influence from points.

georeference.title: Georeference
georeference.desc: Use street addresses, city names, or other location text to generate point geometries.

filter-intersection.title: Filter points in polygons
filter-intersection.desc: Filter points intersecting your polygons layer, and augment those with your polygons columns.

filter.title: Filter rows by column value
filter.desc: Keep or discard rows according to a custom criteria.

merge.title: Join columns from 2nd layer
merge.desc: Join columns from a second layer by linking a shared value found in both datasets.

moran-cluster.title: Detect outliers and clusters
moran-cluster.desc: Use Moran's I to find high (HL) and low (LH) outliers and high (HH) and low (LL) clusters.

kmeans.title: Calculate clusters of points
kmeans.desc: Spatially separate a layer of points into a specified number (N) of groups.

centroid.title: Find centroid of geometries
centroid.desc: Calculate a direct or weighted centroid based on all rows of a layer or by categories.

filter-by-node-column.title: Filter by layer
filter-by-node-column.desc: Filter your layer depending on a second layer such that widgets will effect both.

sampling.title: Subsample percent of rows
sampling.desc: Subsample the rows in a dataset based on a specified percent.

spatial-markov-trend.title: Predict trends and volatility
spatial-markov-trend.desc: Predict probability of upward and downward trends using spatial Markov chains.

data-observatory-measure.title: Enrich from Data Observatory
data-observatory-measure.desc: Add a new column with contextual demographic and economic measures.

add-widgets.modal-desc: Select the widgets you want to add
add-widgets.time-series-no-option-desc: This option won't show your time-series widget

add-layer.modal-desc: Select an existing dataset or connect a new one
